Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hidden Gem!”
Reviews.Author: MissTravellerToronto
Reviews.Content: I had my annual March Break Get Away and because I also write a travel column I checked Trip Advisor and found out about Parc Suites. What I noticed most of all was that everyone talked about the owner Turgay, I figured all of these people can't be wrong... and they weren't! My column isn't up yet but I am in the midst of writing it and thought I would stop to write my review on Trip Advisor. First of all I went right by the hotel because you don't realize it's there. I had to walk back and check for the address again and sure enough there it was! I rang the doorbell and a young man answered and promptly took my luggage up the stairs for me. I was able to get an early check in and they allowed me to check out a bit later as well, and that type of service is deeply appreciated. The room was great with full amenities. I had a European style stand up shower, and was fine with that, and had a full kitchen with a microwave, living room and bedroom. I loved the room and felt like I was in a home away from home. Coras is right downstairs! Now, that's convenient and there is a Provigo down the street for groceries, so you are able to get some frozen dinners or if you choose cook your own meals, or just go to Coras for an awesome breakfast. It is close to the Metro Station, you can also catch buses there that will take you right downtown and it's clean and super convenient. I really don't think that you can ask for anymore. I don't get to Montreal that often but I know that I will not want to stay anywhere else but Parc Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, beautifully appointed & gracious service!”
Reviews.Author: Rhiannon94
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for 2 nights while visiting McGill Univ. Parc Suites was super convenient to the Univ. and to shopping, restaurants, museums and public transportation. The owner Turgay was extremely friendly and helpful. The suite had a full kitchen and living room with a 'backdoor' out to the fire escape. I was a little disappointed that we could no longer use the fire escape to go to the parking lot, but perhaps it was for the best! We did park our car the whole time we were there and that worked out great for us. I was very pleased with the cleanliness and amenities in the suite - it was top notch and I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique in perfect Montreal location”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneKDC
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this boutique for 2 days while in Montreal. The location was very close to McGill, a 15 minute walk to St. Denis Street and many other great shopping areas/restaurants. The front entrance and the rear parking location were a bit sketchy, but once inside the rooms were new and clean. We booked the only studio in the hotel- it was small, but enough for a short weekend visit. If staying longer I would consider booking a 1 bedroom suite where the living room and bedroom are separate. Turgay, the hotel manager, was very friendly and helpful with directions as well. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “I agree”
Reviews.Author: pamelasgordon
Reviews.Content: Have to agree with the highly rated reviews I'm reading. The hotel is very small and there is no elevator, but they carry your bags and gave us parking. It's absolutely charming! The rooms are adorable and very comfortable. The hotel staff is pleasant and accomodating. There's free long distance calls and internet. Cute little restaurants nearby. Very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent property”
Reviews.Author: Rob T
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently had the opportunity to visit Montreal and stay at this little gem. Tourgay and his staff truly bend over backwards to ensure that your stay is comfortable. The property has no evelator but is only 3 stories in height - even though I travelled with school aged children this was not an issue. The hotel staff were very helpful in unloading and loading baggage from our vehicle. The rooms were very clean, hot water was plentiful and the kitchenette was well stocked with all the essential for food preparation. There is a 24 hour grocery store right next door and the metro is about a 5 minute walk away. Very close to McGill and would be an excellent base for anyone moving a student to that instituation in the city. We stayed in a room with a king bed and pullout queen sofabed. The queen sofabed was suprisingly comfortable as these types of sleeping arrangements can be touch and go depending on the hotel. Also included were 2 plasma TV's and free parking through a little laneway behind the hotel. The hotel is an excellent value when used as a home away from home. I would stay here again without question.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: Marek P
Reviews.Content: We highly recommend it to everyone, but as a family of four we found it particularly comfortable and friendly. It's a real safe haven in downtown Montreal, quiet, conveniently located, walking distance to many places, no problem with inexpensive food supplies (it matters when you travel with kids), nice restaurants nearby. Service - amazing, very friendly and helpful. Special thanks to Turgay, the General Manager for his hospitality. Good quality for affordable price, nice service, great location. We really enjoyed it and will not hesitate to come back visiting Montreal again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: momyces
Reviews.Content: I had only booked a studio but was upgraded to a suite at no additional charge. It was unusually hot in Montreal and Turgay, the general manager, gave me the controls for the air conditioner and showed me how it worked. He couldn't have been nicer. Great location on Parc between Sherbrooke and Milton; close to everything and only two blocks from the Place des Arts metro station. I will stay there again. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Shawn H
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently enjoyed a visit Montreal and stayed at the Parc Suites Hotel. Nice rooms with very warm and friendly staff. Great find. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “A great find”
Reviews.Author: AbigKnight
Reviews.Content: We booked this solely on the reviews as newbies to Montreal and everything was as described. Turgay (the owner) and his son were absolutely charming and bent over backwards - even riding in the car to show us exactly where to park. We were also staying during St. Patrick's Day festivities and never heard a sound from outside. As others have noted, the water pressure in the shower is incredibly weak - Turgay said it is a city issue and they are working on it. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “a real find”
Reviews.Author: jane m
Reviews.Content: my daughter is a McGill student, so we have travelled to Montreal many times in the last 4 years, and Parc Suites hotel is a real find. we stayed in the studio, which is small but adequate for our long weekend trip. the king bed was comfortable with almost luxurious linen, the small bathroom with shower was adequate, but major points were with the quiet. we were there over St. Patrick's day weekend, when college students were well lubicated, and the room was a perfect retreat. there were families with children in other suites, whom we never heard. If staying longer or planning to eat meals in the room, you should upgrade to a full suite with a little more room to sit at the table. But as an alternative to other hotels we've stayed at, it's been the best value for the money, and I would certainly look to stay here again in the future. There is no elevator, and a long stair to get to the lobby, but staff was very helpful and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, comfortable and well equipped kitchen”
Reviews.Author: BSCG
Reviews.Content: This hotel was every positive thing the reviews said and more. I have stayed here twice visiting my son in McGill and enjoyed the proximity, friendly and polite staff, free parking, grocery store downstairs and the well equipped kitchen. Yes you can hear the sound of people coming up the stairs but so what you can hear that at home too. There was also free internet, calls to US and Canada and rooms were clean.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasure to Stay....”
Reviews.Author: RoseGoes
Reviews.Content: A wonderful, clean, spacious room with everything you could need and more. The owner was lovely and helpful and even helped us with our luggage. It is a charming little hotel, very quiet and situated perfectly for downtown Montreal. The bed was very comfortable and bedding fresh and crisp. Will will definitely stay here on our next trip to Montreal. There is a Chez Cora restaurant below the hotel and shops, cages and all night stores steps from the door. A great place!

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected... and I won't be going back”
Reviews.Author: LongRoad
Reviews.Content: So trip advisor, you were not correct. Either that or I got the one room that is not a success out of the 6 room hotel. I get there and the owner was nowhere to be found. I waited and rang the bell (in the winter on the side of the road), called two numbers, nothing. 10 minutes later, I finally get buzzed in. When checking in the owner was so very rude and unapologetic. My stay was for 6 days for work, so I thought this place would suit all my needs, what with the kitchen and the homely looking rooms. Not true. There was no iPod dock, no alarm clock, the toilet didnâ€™t flush properly, the shower took literally 20 minutes to heat up and the sheets are maybe 100 thread count?? I was up scratching half the night for a week. I even asked if I could have new sheets, so the manager tells me he would have the sheets washed for me instead because he doesnâ€™t have any extra King size sheets. They only washed the top sheet, so the itch continued. Starch much? First day there, I obviously will need a cab. No one is to be found at the concierge desk... so I had to go and flag one. Not until my 4th day there did someone at the desk offer to call a cab for me. Also, the rooms that face the back alley are forced to listen to a very loud heating/cooling system so I hope you can sleep with noise! Because this is NOT a quiet hotel. Needless to say, I will not be going back. People I spoke to that live in Montreal all said that Lâ€™appartment is the place to stay, so next time, thatâ€™s where I will be. I am only giving this hotel 1 star based on the location. Hotel Du Fort was a 1970â€™s retro hotel, but this place takes the cake for places not to stay at. It reminded me of a crappy bachelor pad in college!

Reviews.Title: “Short but wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Alanna G
Reviews.Content: The staff treated us really well and were very nice throughout the whole trip. The owner greeted us and made sure that we were settled and everything was good. The apartment style room was fully equipped, and was very clean and had a nice design. View was looking onto the street which was also pretty cool. They called us a cab when we needed and location was great! We were located right on top of coras and right beside a pharmacy and grocery store. The area was also good, and felt safe. Will definitely stay here again if visiting Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Hotel Parc c'est magnifique!”
Reviews.Author: mrsdavis82206
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. The hotel was kind of us to let us check in early when we arrived in Montreal sooner than we had expected. The young Parisian women who greeted us was very friendly and accomodating with the helping us with our luggage and locating the free parking in back of the hotel. The room was very clean and comfortable. I recommend the king-sized suite. Pluses: full working kitchen, an amazing grocery store located nearby, friendly service, you pay when you get there in full- and free unlimited wi-fi and phone calls to the US and Canada at no extra charge. Free parking. A metro is also located nearby if you need it. Cons: Free parking is located in a small area in back of the hotel out in the open which can be a bit troublesome in winter- summer should be no issue. Location of the hotel could be a bother for those who want to be a bit closer to Rue Catherine. Again summer time this should be no big deal, but winter is a different story. Although I didn't find it a big deal, if you want an elevator, this is not the hotel for you. Tips: Run the water in the shower or bath for at least two minutes otherwise you will think there is no hot water. Ask for extra soaps or shampoos- some of ours were 1/2 full- but that could be due to the fact they let us check in early. The staff again is wonderful! Thanks for everything. Because of the full kitchen and grocery store nearby, this would be great if you have kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot with even better staff and ownership.”
Reviews.Author: DWG10
Reviews.Content: I had to come to Montreal for a few days for an event and was lucky to find the Parc Suites! Nice clean rooms with a great loaction close to the city and some nice restaurants and cafe's. The front desk staff and manager were so very helpful at all times and helped me where ever and when ever I needed.... I will be back and if you are reading this, you should try it for sure

Reviews.Title: “Great value, Friendly service”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynTriptaker
Reviews.Content: Parc Suites was a satisfying choice for our 4 days in Montreal. Our suite was large and comfortable and clean. Parking was behind the hotel and was a little tricky to find, but the owner Turgay accompanied us to the spot and helped carry our bags to the door, and then showed us our room himself--he obviously takes great pride in his hotel and seeks out ways to improve it. He acknowledged that the shower water pressure wasn't great due to local zoning rules, but that was the only flaw we noticed during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: CarlIthaca
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here on a vacation trip to Montreal and found Parc Suites to be a great value in a great location. The suite was perfect - high ceilings and windows, nicely decorated, etc. - and for a small hotel the staff were always available, friendly and anxious to please. In terms of location it's close to Mt. Royal and withing walking distance to the old city and much else. Nice to have free parking around back though the walk around to the front entrance at night to or from the parking area might not be to everyone's comfort level. No elevator so you will have to walk up some steps, moreso if you are on the 3rd level, but the added exercise is great. Wonderful to have the added room with the suite and especially frig, microwave, cookstove, etc. Bed was very comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful to new tourists of Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: ecuface
Reviews.Content: This hotel is small and cute, with only 8 rooms. The rooms are small suites with kitchens and separate bedrooms. Our room was fabulous and clean. The hotel is about 2 blocks from the Place de Arts train station, which was convenient it us getting around Montreal. The staff was helpful it helping us with our bags in and out of the hotel and telling us where the markets and a few restaurants were located close by. The hotel was located a little further away from the things we wanted to do (Old Montreal, the Bell Center, etc), but for the price, staff, size, etc it was worth it. It would have been nice to be in downtown Montreal. Next time, we might consider a hotel closer, but only because we do not know the city that well. However, the Metro is very easy to use. The staff even set up a cab for us the next morning to get us back to Central Station. I'd recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Disapointed, not clean, the towels in the room had stains!”
Reviews.Author: canadiencyn
Reviews.Content: The staff informed me that the previous weekend the hÃ´tel was full therefore the Cleaning staff had their Hands full! This understood! No comps where offered, come on stained towels, who wants that! And the stains on the carpet! ... When you cash out the dow for a great hÃ´tel! You expect clean! canadiencyn@hotmail.com

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: 500Linda
Reviews.Content: Extremely clean; attractive decor. Bedding impeccable and more than comfortable. Bathroom spotless and functional-even a cabinet for your cosmetic bags. Well equipped kitchenette. Location central to many Montreal attractions, especially if you don't mind walking a little. (Avenue St. Laurent, Plateau, Latin Quarter, Place des Arts) Many good restaurants, shopping, and excellent grocery stores in vicinity. (Galleries du Parc amazing for groceries, wine store (SAQ) and repertory cinema one short block away) Staff and mangement are accommodating. Free parking definitely adds value to the price of the stay. Some street noise which may be a factor in summer months.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small hotel in downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: PPLJudy
Reviews.Content: Very clean, very friendly staff (just remember my name as "Tour Guy"). The room was small (studio suite) but contained everything - kitchenette, nice big TV, beautiful washroom. Very comfortable and central to everything we needed. "Tour Guy" was great with parking our car in the FREE parking and recommending restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: Linda F
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Parc Suites Hotel in November, we found the hotel to be extremely clean the units to be large and comfortable. The owner Turgay went above and beyond to ensure our stay was comfortable, thank you very much for your help. We will certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely FANTASTIC accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Jade B
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had spent an amazing two evenings at Parc Suites - we plan to stay at this hotel from now on during our frequent visits to Montreal. Fantastic management and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: Altarasj
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this charming hotel in January. The owner, Turgay is the most service oriented, accommodating person I have ever encountered in this business. He adds to the warmth and charm of Parc Suites. The rooms are very clean and the place is quiet. Conveniently located very near the metro and old Montreal. We will absolutely stay here again. Nice job Turgay!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience, felt like home”
Reviews.Author: R S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Parc Suites on a recent vacation in Montreal. We both have severe food allergies so travel can be difficult for us, but staying at Parc Suites made things much easier since there is a grocery store next door and we could cook our own meals in the kitchenette. It does have an excellent location, close to the metro and busiest section of St. Catherine. The service is really top-notch. The rooms look recently renovated and are very clean. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: Dave_Berr
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Montreal to visit our daughter at McGill. Historically, we've tried different hotels in and around the City. This time we stayed at Parc Suites. I would have to say that this will be our 'go to' hotel from now on. Very convenient location, great service (thanks Turgay!), very comfortable room with nice amenities.

Reviews.Title: “This is a good place to be”
Reviews.Author: Janet P
Reviews.Content: I chose this place primarily because of the excellent location. The first thing that happened is that I was upgraded from the pleasant small room I had been assigned to a really beautiful suite. It was very well maintained, clean, and comfortable, which turned out to be a good thing, since I ended up spending a lot of time in it. I had the misfortune of getting food poisoning, and the proprietor could not have been nicer or more helpful. I got sick late at night, and he personally went out in -21 degree weather to buy me some ginger ale. He also let me stay in the room several hours past checkout time so I could rest until I had to go to the airport. I would recommend this hotel without reservation in any case, but the owners' generosity and kindness make it truly exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: Will M
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel, and would stay there again. The location was perfect. Practically right beside the hotel is a 24 hour grocery store, which made it super convenient with the fully equipped kitchen to have a very affordable mini vacation. The owner was exceptionally friendly, and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem in the City!”
Reviews.Author: Vicki M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Parc Suites Hotel last week for 3 nights and we found the hotel to be extremely clean and the units to be very large and certainly better than staying in a 5 star Montreal hotel! (which we've both done several times) The owner/general manager of the Parc Suites Hotel went above and beyond to ensure our stay was comfortable including recommending a fantastic french restaurant not even 1 block away! He really made our stay that much more enjoyable and stress free. I can't say anything bad about this hotel because it really ticked all the boxes for us. If you're visiting Montreal, don't think twice....book this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy K
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Montreal for a week long busy trip and stayed at Parc Suites. The hotel was excellent. It was centrally located, was just 5 minutes walk to two grocery stores, multiple restaurants and an excellent bakery. The metro and train station were within a 10 and 20 minute walk or an easy 5 minute cab ride. The room I stayed in was quiet, extremely spacious and well equipped. What really sets the hotel apart from the larger chains is the excellent and personable service I received. Everyone was so friendly and kind during my stay, particularly Turgay the owner. I was set to depart in the early afternoon and I was allowed to keep my bags in the hotel until my departure while I worked at the local office building I was visiting. If I return to Montreal to stay for business or a vacation I will definitely stay at the Parc Suites again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, great place!”
Reviews.Author: Kim B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a kitchen fire that put us out of our home for 2 weeks. During our extended stay at the Parc Suites Hotel we were treated so kindly it made an awful situation much more endurable. From the free parking and great location to the excellent room size and wonderful staff - I would gladly recommend this hotel to anyone. The only negative side is that there are quite a few homeless people in the area, so walking to the car in the back alley can be bothersome at times, but overall this was not an issue whatsoever. For one night or a long-term stay like ours, the hotel staff will make you feel at home in this small, elegant, family-oriented hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Catherine H
Reviews.Content: We had a perfect stay at this hotel and I would give this hotel a top recommendation. The hotel is ideal - the central location, the personable service, the friendliness of the staff especially the owner of the hotel, the size of the suites along with the quality of finish and cleanliness of all of the interiors. There are many extras too - the free ability to make phone calls across Canada and US, the well equipped kitchen in the suite accompanied with an excellent supermarket / patisserie adjacent to the hotel. We will certainly return to this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint”
Reviews.Author: Steph J
Reviews.Content: Turgay is the owner and is probably the most hospitable and friendly guy there is- he personally gave us a tour of the hotel and room. On the phone in the room, his cell phone number is on speed dial if you are to need anything at any time of day. I stayed in the studio suite with my boyfriend and we have no complaints. The kitchen area is fully stocked with pans, pots, dish ware, cups etc. There is a lot of storage spaces available as well. The bathroom has a stand-in shower which was modern and very clean. Also the bathroom mirror was gorgeous. The room has a large Queen sized bed, a flat screen TV with DVD player, and a desk. The only down side to this room is it is on the other side of the wall of the receptionist area. It was VERY QUIET, but be aware it is sharing a wall with the employee. Overall very clean, modern, accommodating and quiet. The breakfast place down stairs really is amazing! Best latte ever! The Location being right down town was great, we never even had to use the metro since everything is within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Hasan Y
Reviews.Content: Nice and large suites, very clean, well decorated, free parking, free wi-fi, free, free phone calls to North America. Just perfect. I strongly recommend Parc Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Convenient and Clean with Caring, Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: M H
Reviews.Content: The Parc Suites Hotel provides an exceptionally hospitable atmosphere. Although we are in our 70's, we chose to be on the third floor and we did not find the stairs to be a problem. The staff was always there to carry, not only luggage, but groceries as well. The hotel is quiet - we were never disturbed by sounds from other suites or from the street. The full size fridge, stove and microwave (with a supermarket next door) provided the opportunity to make any meals we desired. Free internet and telephone calls within North America are an added bonus. With 2 flat screen TV's, King size bed, a breakfast restaurant below, walking distance to the Metro and shopping areas, it would be difficult to find a more convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: moxie2003
Reviews.Content: In reading the negative reviews submitted, I realized the general thread of discontent is due to the writers unrealistic expectations and physical laziness! There are many stairs to climb up I do agree, but if you are moderately healthy it should be of no issue. If there are kids, get them out of the stroller and let them run up the stairs! My husband and I came up for the Thanksgiving weekend and had a lovely stay. The manager helped us with our luggage checking in and leaving, personally took my husband to the parking lot behind the hotel. Our room is on the top floor, which is 3 flights of stairs up, facing the street. Had a cute little fire escape veranda to check out the street and let in some fresh air. WE are in our mid forties, and see climbing the stairs as exercise to burn off all those extra calories from the great food in Montreal. We love our king size bed, it was firm and supportive and gave us excellent nights sleep. The sheets were clean and fresh. The kitchen was fully stocked with the necessary pots and pans and utensils, the fridge was clean. I like the bathroom as it was very clean and bright. The hot water took a bit of time getting to me but that's fine as long as I do get hot water! Took a bath and there was plenty of hot water! And the best thing of all is that my towels smells nice! Most hotel towels have this industrial laundry smell, mine smells like I have done the laundry myself. The sitting room is comfy, couch is perfect for us to catch some tv time after a long day of sight seeing. I do wish for brighter lighting in this space, but that is just a personal preference of mine. Is the furniture brand spanking new? Nope, but they are not old and decrepit either. In any hotel that has been around for awhile, the furniture will take some beating. For the price we paid, we are completely satisfied and happy with the condition of the room. We are already planning our next stay at this very welcoming and home away from home. And in addition, there is a large grocery store very close by, a bakery a few steps away, a little breakfast joint attached to the hotel, Metro station less than 5 mins away. The location is very convenient and accessible to many restaurants. I would highly recommend a stay here any time!

Reviews.Title: “A Gem”
Reviews.Author: LSG47
Reviews.Content: A small, all-suite hotel that is reasonably priced, clean, comfortable, and relaxing, with as attentive a staff as any traveler could hope for. Add in free parking, free internet, free telephone to Canada and the US, and perfect location--walking distance to great restaurants, the best movie theater in Montreal, and lots of shopping--and there is no reason at all to spend more money for less value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jeff J
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful place to stay in a great neighborhood near McGill University. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the staff is extremely friendly. Lots of places to eat nearby and it's centrally located to everything.

Reviews.Title: “First trip to Montreal...Parc Suites made it so easy!”
Reviews.Author: 810IrenaC
Reviews.Content: We arrived late on Thursday evening and were shown exactly where to park (free and secure off the street!)...then our bags were carried up the two flights to our room. The room was perfect for us. Two slept in the bedroom, one on the pull out sofa bed. The bathroom was impeccably clean and with ample room to unpack toiletries, and the kitchen is perfectly set up for us to cook (oh, and a market two doors down to buy food and wine). The best home away from home experience I've had in a hotel yet. Not to mention it's a short walk from lots of attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Our Montreal Stay...”
Reviews.Author: Dcappi
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Tuesday early afternoon and were promptly and courteously checked-in and given parking instructions (easy!) and some general information about the motel and the area! The people at the desk were nice and courteous and the room was great! Clean, modern, spacious, with a nice cooking area and free phone calls and internet! There were even fresh flowers in the room! All in all, it was a very enjoyable stay! We'd stay there again and we'd recommend it to friends!

Reviews.Title: “Parc Suites Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TSB76
Reviews.Content: When we arrived on a Saturday night we were greeted by the owner who helped with our luggage. Our hotel suite was excellent with a kitchen (stove, refrigerator, cooking utensils and silverware), two lcd televisions and a balcony. The location was great as you are within walking distance to the Mont Royal, Old Montreal, St. Catherines, grocery stores and the metro. Plenty of restaurants nearby as well as a bakery. The staff was friendly and the service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby, hot water not always available, three flights of stairs to climb, no a/c offered ....”
Reviews.Author: Susan G
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and the room was well cleaned. The room was smaller than it appeared on line. The remote for the air/conditioning was not in the room when the temperature reached 26 degrees Celsius, I decided to ask for it. The pull out couch was old and the bed could not be put back into the couch without assistance. Hot water was not always available. The furniture was old and shabby. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Feels Like Home”
Reviews.Author: Quegustaviajar
Reviews.Content: This hotel does not feel like a hotel, it feels like you are at home in a miniature apartment. You can entertain friends and business associates in the living room portion without having to feel like you are setting in a bedroom. There is a TV in both the living room and bedroom. It has a small kitchen and even some rooms have a balcony that you can squeeze out on, not that the view of the seedy stretch of Parc is worth seeing. Only downside is that there is no room service, pop machines, ice, etc that you would get in a big hotel, so you are reliant on the neighbourhood, such as it is, for that. As for breakfast, try the Milton just east on the first cross street to the North if you are not into Coras. Also, staff are great, really helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: monkeyluvs
Reviews.Content: The rooms were a decent size and very clean with a nice kitchen. The staff was fantastic - very polite and welcoming. Location is ok - a block and a half away from green line metro, close to McGill Ghetto and about a 25 minute walk to Old Montreal. The 24 store grocery store next door is nasty, use it only in emergency. We stocked up at a regular supermarket a few doors down towards rue Sherbrook instead. The only real negative is the 5-day a week construction across the street with noise starting at 7 am, so try to ask for the rear facing room. Chez Cora breakfast place downstairs is at best average and overpriced but fun for small children - the menu has pictures and food comes beautifully decorated with fruit. Chez Gaultier a copule of doors down has better prix-fixe breakfast for the same amount of money. There's a fun (and expensive) wine bar called Pullman across the street for a late drink - check out the huge chandelier made of wine glasses. Interesting little fact - if you buy a day pass for Metro it expires at exactly same time as time of purchase next day as opposed to midnight of same day. So if you plan right, you can save some $.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: TOmoles
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parc Suites over the weekend of September 9 to 11, 2011. We came to Montreal to see the Grand Prix Cycliste Montreal, and the hotel location was ideal: the race start/finish line was only about a seven minute walk up Parc. This lovely little hotel is well-located, an easy walk to the train station, the subway, and to many attractions on foot. It was a pleasant walk from the hotel to Old Montreal and the Plateau--particularly to Beauty's, Fairmont Bagel and Schwartz's, our three "must do" destinations every time we go to Montreal. We were delighted with our suite, which was beautiful, clean and well organized. The kitchen was well-supplied. Our room (number 1 or 2 I recall) had a lovely little balcony looking out on Parc, a lively street with lots of foot traffic. We ate our breakfast there each morning, and again each evening before dinner. There's a grocery store just steps to the south of the hotel, and a fabulous boulangerie/patisserie just a few steps to the north, if you want to stock up and have breakfast in your suite. The well-equipped kitchen has a coffee maker and under-counter frig. There is a flight of stairs up to the hotel from the street, which is neither long nor onerous. Not ideal for a person with a disability but otherwise, not daunting except perhaps for the most out-of-shape couch potato. The staff was unobtrusive unless asked for help, and then they were warm and very helpful. We will stay here again the next time we come to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Unchanged”
Reviews.Author: waki
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable, large suites. Free parking. Great staff. Steep long stairs.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best!”
Reviews.Author: soleil806
Reviews.Content: An outstanding boutique hotel, welcoming staff, well-equipped suites, clean and fabulous location near to downtown, but still in a residential area as well. Compared to boutique hotels i have stayed in Paris, NYC , LOndon and Edinburgh, i would say this is now my favorite. The difference is in the careing staff, and comfortable suite-small apartment. Top notch. There is a flight of stairs but it is worth the climb; I am sr. citizen age and happily climbed to find comfort and peaceful atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and well located”
Reviews.Author: Bigjake33
Reviews.Content: This is a comfortable hotel with friendly, helpful staff. The guy on reception when we arrived helped us with our bags and accompanied us in our car to the parking, which would otherwise have been difficult to locate. On arrival keep an eye out for the small awning, as the location is not obvious and we drove past it the first time. The room was quite large with good aircon, a big comfy bed, tv, fridge, cooker, sink, microwave, kettle, coffee maker etc. There was a decent sized bathroom with a good shower. It was right next to reception, but that wasn't a problem and we didn't experience any noise. It was a 10 minute walk to the city centre and other areas were easily accessible on the mÃ©tro (4-5 minutes walk to Place des Arts). There was a store just down the block with a good choice of food and drinks. The staircase was long and steep (no elevator) which didn't bother us but might if you struggle on stairs. Whilst the free parking was a welcome service it was located at the end of a seedy alley populated by drunks - again it didn't really bother us as we left the car there for the whole stay, but it's not the type of place to go late at night. Still these things exist in all big cities, and in truth it didn't detract at all from our stay. So, overall we enjoyed our stay at Parc Suites - a comfortable, friendly, well-located place to stay for exploring MontrÃ©al.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Perfect location to everything. Would highly recommend.”
Reviews.Author: LBSMAS
Reviews.Content: We parked our car (for free) and didn't use it again until check out! Owners and staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay at the Parc Suites Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lucky094
Reviews.Content: I just loved my two nights stay in the Parc Suites Hotel. First of all the room was very clean and bright with conveniences of a small kitchen. I liked the assistance and service altogether provided by the stuff of the hotel. And finally but not least the rates are just rocking. Great service with great prices- what else could you ask for. Thank you for my wonderful stay at your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Jenb08fl
Reviews.Content: We stayed there towards the end of June and had a very nice time in this hotel.We came in with a lot of bags and the person behind the desk helped us out to carry them without even us asking.It is a great location,short distance from Ste Catherine street ,lots of restaurants .There is a very good breakfast place underneath the hotel.The staff is very helpful and gave us good recommendations and suggestions .We will surely stay there again if we go back to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “a very nice place with a couple of caveats....”
Reviews.Author: TravelingFishnet
Reviews.Content: a big benefit is free parking, the room we had was very clean, the owner and his siter were very accomodating. the room had a small kitchen, there was a "living room" and bedroom...all similar to a small apartment. the price was right also. there is a very long flight of stairs to reach the reception desk, and then, if you're on the second floor, two other small flights. ...not for elderly/handicapped. also, we were asked to pay in advance (3 days) and they only refund with a day+ notice,. so plan carefully, if you have to leave before your reservation ends you'll be out at least one night's payment. and, yes, we were harassed by the local drunks...they are pushy and obnoxious.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Comfort, Hospitality, Parking”
Reviews.Author: tangOh
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Parc Suites Hotel four times in the past three years. Clearly I am a fan. Originally my reasons were practical: included parking, location, and public transportation. They are still strong factors, but the lodgings and the hospitality are just as strong now that I have experienced them. My Montreal trips are vacations centered on Argentine tango. Parc Suites is the nicest hotel that is convenient (by public transportation, car, or sometimes by foot) to the dance venues. The Provigo supermarket and drugstore are just a few doors down Parc. Parc Suites' WiFi is very fast. For my first stay in 2009, there were fresh cut lilacs from the owner's garden. For my most recent stay, there was a delicious fruit basket. The owner and staff are warm, friendly and very helpful. As for the welcoming stairway, I consider that as part of a European boutique experience and welcome the fitness it brings me throughout my stay. I will stay at Parc Suites the next I am in Montreal---whenever that might be. Excellent hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, very comfortable bed, extremely helpful and friendly, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: KerrynPerth
Reviews.Content: We were visiting our son who lives in 'McGill Ghetto' and the Parc Suites couldn't have been a more convenient location, but it wasn't just the location, they were so helpful and friendly and provided the most comfortable bed, well equipped kitchenette, laundromat across the road, free parking out the back, quiet and well priced.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service, Great Location, A Real Gem.”
Reviews.Author: Homer999_11
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise. A small hotel with friendly and helpful staff. Newly renovated and very clean. I would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: larish
Reviews.Content: We spend 2 nights in Parc Suits Hotel with our friends. Very good hotel, 5min from St. Katherine st, helpfull stuff, clean and nice rooms,, very good beds. Next time - only this hotel. New York.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Courteous Accommodations in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: CherylD79
Reviews.Content: I was pleased with our room at Parc Suites. Although smaller than I thought it would be, it was certainly not too small, even for my husband and I, our two children (1 and 3 yrs), and my father. It was very clean and we found the bed comfortable. My three year old and father shared the pull out couch, and while my son and his toys were quite comfortable, my father did mentioned that he had to position himself around the support bar in order to get comfortable. I would suggest replacing the pull out or offering guests a thick mattress pad to add to the mattress. We loved having the kitchenette in the room, which was very convenient for breakfast since a grocery store was nearby. The only negatives are that the convenient store next to the hotel seems to be the local drunk hangout, which can be disconcerting when walking around it to get to the free parking behind the hotel. Also, there is no elevator, which, before we decided to leave it in the trunk of the car, made using our double stroller a little bit of a hassle. However, the staff was always more than willing to help us, which was nice. I would stay here again and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: mcelhit
Reviews.Content: While planning my next vacation, I realized I forgot to write a review for where I stayed last year. This hotel was very nice. It was clean and the staff was courteous and friendly. They even supplied umbrellas to us when it rained, which it did a lot. I recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: NealR2000
Reviews.Content: For us, it was perfect. Family with small children, arriving with our own car. The suites were perfect for us. Very clean. Staff are extremely pleasant and helpful. The free parking is a big plus as almost all Montreal hotels charge daily parking. The location is no big deal. Okay, it's slightly out of the way, but it's still very walkable, and public transport is close by. The area has great dining options, including PÃ¢tisserie Belge two doors away, which is a Montreal institution for its transendent pastries. Very strong wifi signal everywhere in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: ReddyM
Reviews.Content: This is my first time at Parc Suites.The experience at Parc suites was way over my expectations. Even my friend who is local to Montreal did not know about Parc Suites until he visited me while staying there. He was completely surprised and impressed. Its a hidden Gem.The staff and the manager are very friendly and offered great customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but LONG stairs. ( No elevator )”
Reviews.Author: waki
Reviews.Content: Longest staircase I've ever used. But, EXCELLENT staff, VERY accomodating. Free VALET parking. Rooms small but clean & quiet

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: ozan1990
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and clean. It is in the heart of Montreal, employees are very friendly and warm to every one. If you are looking for a friendly clean environment this is definitely the right place to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for Wintertime Travel”
Reviews.Author: timmay56
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights in December - not the greatest access to the Old City as one might prefer, especially in winter, but if you don't mind a little walk (really less than a half hour to pretty much anything in the downtown/old area, it was a spectacular place to stay. It was inexpensive, offered free parking, and for the price the kitchen and sitting area is especially nice to have. There is a grocery store right down the street, at which you can buy anything and you can then enjoy having a modest meal in your own place. I would certainly stay there were I to visit Montreal again and would recommend it to any of my friends. The staff were all very friendly, accommodating and helpful. The proximity to McGill was nice and it was easy to walk to Mont Royal and check out the views from up there. The walk to the downtown area was pretty quick and a little further on to the Old Port area. It was chilly at night but still easy to get back to the hotel via the underground networks of malls/metro stops. Again, the only thing I might suggest is that if you want to see stuff in the Old Port and can't face the walk (less than thirty minutes as I recall) then I would recommend searching for a spot in the Old Port area itself. The neighborhood around this hotel seemed perfectly safe - I felt completely comfortable walking around there.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, spacious suite with a most accomodating staff”
Reviews.Author: cartneyjames
Reviews.Content: This small hotel (8 suites) is a true gem. The staff couldn't have been more friendly or helpful. Our room was simply furnished but clean, well lit, and contained everything necessary. As if this hotel needed anything additional to make it a bargain, it has free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but needs work”
Reviews.Author: TrueThermal
Reviews.Content: Great location and very good value for a one bedroom suite. The front desk people were very helpful and courteous. That said, it is getting a bit run down. Our sofa was truly a throw away and rather ratty. Sit in the middle and you sank into a hole. As a sofa bed it was useless. The missing mattress on the sofa bed was retrieved by the night manager at 11 when we decided to go to bed and discovered this oversight. The sofa bed springs were broken and simply tied together so we just put the mattress on the floor. Note to management. Replace this sofa. The kitchen was functional; the stove was showing its age with a warped burner and the electric kettle was corroded and unusable. It's time for the owners to invest some money in an otherwise decent accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Parc Suites was like 'our home away from home'!”
Reviews.Author: Phillyboy51
Reviews.Content: After several horrible years of health problems and family crises, my wife and I desperately needed a vacation and were in no mood for anything to go wrong. We wanted to relax in a cozy way and enjoy Montreal. The staff and accommodations at Parc Suites were the perfect answer. The staff was simply wonderful. Everyone at the front desk was friendly, helpful and informative. The women who cleaned our rooms were marvelous. Maybe the best comment on the staff comes from one of the front desk folks themselves. They told me that their hope was to make Parc Suites like our â€˜home away from homeâ€™. We feel they succeeded. We had a very comfy and clean one bedroom suite. The queen size bed was extremely comfortable, which says a lot considering that we ainâ€™t young and have many aches and pains. We found the living room and kitchen area roomy. We love to cook and used the kitchen a lot. Weâ€™re food nuts so we always bring two of our own pans and some spices but the kitchen is supplied well. We cooked amazing dinners of salmon, marlin, buffalo, veal, duck, chicken wrapped in bacon, rib eye steak and lamb loins in that kitchen. Thereâ€™s two large flat screen TVs, one in the living room and one in the bedroom. For you computer nerds, the dvd player in the living room desk not only plays dvds but also plays mp3 music files and avi video files. (Video in avi format lets me put 4-5 movies on one dvd disc, so we could bring most of our extensive music and movie library and play them through the living room television.) Thereâ€™s also free and reliable internet connections that are both wireless and wired. The location couldnâ€™t be better. The hotel is centrally located and near Old Montreal, the underground, Chinatown, etc. We walked many places or drove short distances out to the neighborhoods and to the Jean Talon and Atwater open markets and La Maison Du Roti butcher shop â€“ must sees if you love food. Thereâ€™s a great supermarket just doors away and another a block and a half up Avenue Du Parc. The restaurant downstairs from the hotel is terrific for breakfast and lunch. If youâ€™re into beer, Benelux and their wonderful brews are literally around the corner. Finally, Iâ€™d like to address two of the complaints I read in past reviews of this hotel. First, yes, there is no elevator. Our suite was on the top floor and although we can walk, both of us are disabled. But no matter, the front desk person enthusiastically carried our luggage upstairs without complaint. My wife and I viewed the climb upstairs after each outing as part of our daily exercise and in no detracted from our very enjoyable stay. Second, someone complained about the homeless folks and that the hotel was â€˜on the wrong side of the tracksâ€™. Without being overly political, homeless people are unfortunately a fact of life in many cities. My wife and I both dealt with homeless people through our jobs so maybe weâ€™re not as put off by them as some other travelers may be. We actually found the Montreal homeless we encountered to be polite, friendly, and non-threatening. Besides, when we walked around the corner past the Hilton Garden Inn, a homeless person politely asked us for money. Is the Hilton â€˜the wrong side of the tracksâ€™?

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable in the heart of downtown Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: jmonacelli
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a very nice stay at this hotel. We pretty much walked everywhere except for 2 places for which we drove. The bed was comfortable and we slept great. The room (Studio Suite - King Bed) was a little tight though. The breakfast restaurant below had wonderful freash food!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great location, friendly staff = excellent experience!”
Reviews.Author: wascorose
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at Parc Suites while visiting Montreal for the jazz festival... And what a great experience! We were two blocks from the actual festival and could come and go to the shows we wanted to catch with great ease. There were a couple of metro stations near by which we used, but seriously a lot of things are within walking distance! (Including the supermarket 2 doors down and several cafes/restaurants around the corner - and even one downstairs!) The rooms were comfortable and clean. The staff was friendly and helpful! This was our favorite hotel during the entire trip :-) Would stay there again and definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean accommodation just the wrong side of the tracks”
Reviews.Author: savouk
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here and agree with previous reviews. Accommodation is clean, comfortable and offers everything you are likely to need. Staff are conscientious and helpful and a large supermarket about 50 yds away is a bonus. But at about $550 for 3 nights it is not a bargain. Our only criticism of the accommodation was the view from the rear (we had Room 8) over roofs with waste bags piled up awaiting disposal. The immediate local area is rather run down with the odd beggar or derelict, and the walk down Park Street to the old town is neither attractive nor just a few minutes. But turn left down Park Street and right into Sherbrook and a different world emerges. Try the art gallery and the nearby shops/cafes. Lots of eating places around though we were very disappointed with Pasta & Basta at the junction of Park and Sherbrook.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location, wonderful owners.”
Reviews.Author: MattyOregon
Reviews.Content: Booked 3 rooms for elderly parents, my brother's family (2 kids), and my family (2 kids) and stayed for 3 nights. Excellent location, really nice staff. Carpet was a bit dirty, but it could just be my crazy idea of clean. FYI: Parking is a bit tricky, the man working the desk actually got into our car with us and directed us to the small spaces in the back. It's small, but we were driving a Suburban and managed to fit. Also, if you cannot manage steep stairs, it might not be a great place for you. Staff was extremely helpful in getting our luggage up and down the stairs, but you still have to walk it!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: chickendance
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews, and we definately made the right decision. The suite was immaculate and tastefully decorated. It was equipped with everything we needed (free calls to US/Canada, free internet, free parking, comfy beds, ipod dock, 2 flat screen TVs, ample kitchen stuff(!) etc. The staff team was great. Friendly and helpful without being overbearing and intrusive. Good communication from owner prior to arrival and we were treated very fairly when we became a party of two instead of three. We were very pleased with the location, take a left on leaving the hotel to get to the main downtown attractions in a matter of a few minutes or head right to get to the park. In terms of other reviewers' concerns regarding the stairs: we did not find them a problem. And yes there were some homeless people around but no cause for alarm. We had a great stay and thank you to the lady who gave us gorgeous muffins on my sister's birthday!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the climb!”
Reviews.Author: kayteeYVR
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 6 day stay for a professional conference. At the last minute my daughter (age 20) decided to tag along with my colleague and I. She called Montreal "the result when Europe and New York City decide to have a child". I think that means that she likes the place. First impressions were a bit iffy. A few intoxicated (seemingly homeless) people were leaned up against the side of the building with their hats open for our donation. Eek, what had we done? Once we crossed the threshold and climbed 30 stairs to the reception area, we knew we were in good hands. We received a friendly greeting and were offered assistance with our bags (which is no small thing given the vertical challenges here). Although we were offered a room at the level of the reception area, we decided to brave an additional hike of 21 stairs to room 8. It faces the rear of the building and is very quiet. Rooms (in this case a 1 BR suite) are updated and ours was very comfortable and quiet. We could see the conference hotel from our "balcony" (a fire escape, outfitted with one chair and some blooming geraniums) and as time passed, we became more and more happy to be staying so near but so off the beaten path. In the light of day, the homeless folk had departed (convenience store with beer for sale is apparently a great attraction) and the neighborhood character was more fully revealed (area is pulsating with university students, given the location close to McGill). We loved the extended hours supermarket next door (great for stocking up on water and breakfast fixings), the easy walk (10 min) to the Hyatt conference center, and reasonable walk (within 30 minutes) to many great areas with fabulous restaurants (such as L'Academie where you can bring your own wine). Even a simple bistro on Sherbrooke and Parc, steps from the hotel (with cardboard cutout of ice cream cone dangling in the window) offered outstanding pizza at a bargain price. Staff couldn't have been nicer. My colleagues had family members visit for a few hours and a staff member hopped into the family's car to escort them to the free parking (access is a bit tricky with all of the one way streets in the area). Whenever we asked for anything (such as extra towels or a taxi) we were quickly accommodated. Chain hotels are a dime a dozen but a stay in a place like this is memorable. Why think twice? I miss it already. It became our home away from home in our week in Montreal, a wonderful city to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Would certainly recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mounteden
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Quebec today. We arrived at the Parc Suites a couple of weeks ago and decided to book here as reviews read positive. We were not dissapointed. We travelled with our 2 young daughters (age 3 and 5). We stayed 3 nights initially and our stay was so comfortable we booked our last night here again prior to our return flight home (having travelled for 2 wks). It is in the heart of Montreal despite what reviews may suggest. It's a 5 min walk to the local metro station. Montreal is a huge city. We got round the city with 2 young daughters without the need for metro, car or bus. It's in walking distance to every where a tourist wants to see be it the old quarter, queyside, latin quarter, malls, the huge main parc, Rue Sherbrooke not to mention pretty good restaurants, take outs also close by plus supermarket and pharmacist 2 min walk away. The rooms are not huge but they are spotlessly clean and very confortable. We booked rooms that consisted of a sofa bed and a double bed (1 bed suite) which accommodated us fine. Fresh smelling bed linen and towels. Both the living area and bedroom had flat screen TV's. The bathroom was spotless and the kitchen was suffiient. The stairs to the reception are not as bad as the photo's or what seems to be sugested by some. The staff were the most helpful with accommodating our needs and each individual person was extremely friendly. We would definately stay here again if we return to Montreal in the future. Room 1 was slightly bigger than our 1st room, room 4. probably worth the extra little bit of money.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel...OK, the surroundings... Hmmm”
Reviews.Author: moris41
Reviews.Content: Hello. Ok, here goes my first review, ever, so I'll try to make it short, to the point and as objective as possible. The hotel itself is rather small and as the add says, these are suites in the heart of Montreal. The entrace is clean, up-the stairs, and the suites are clean but I found them a little smaller than expected. There was a kitchenette so cooking was possible and we took advantage of the grocery store a few feet south (towards Sherbrooke) which is a rather large store. And the service, Oskar was very, very attentive and tried to make us feel comfortable. That being said, there are a few 'down' sides that would make me think go here twice,,, with family that is. As in any large city (I guess including Toronto) beggars are part of the landscape, but this time, too close for my own comfort. The place next door seemed like an abandoned Chinese/Japanese restaurant where the beggars hang. They are quiet but just their presence made me feel un-easy. Quite honestly, this is the first time I felt insecure in Canada. Can you believe it? The parking was in back of the hotel and the access less than comfortable, in order to go to the back you could take the shortest route which is a passage between a large wall and a convenience store (note: If you go to buy groceries, my advice is not to go there) and it smelled like pee. I even caught a guy urinaring who promptly leaned towards the wall when saw me coming. When I first noticed where the car was going to be parked (my own car, not rental) I felt very uneasy. I asked the bellboy if there was any sort of security and he said all the guests parked their cars there and with no issues. They have a surveillance camera (hope they DO watch!) Then, I went back to check it out and the area was very well lit, but just the fact that it was out in the open and in that not so welcomy area made me feel uneasy. Nothing happened, thank goodness. Again, this may have been my perception and since I have never felt this uneasiness anywhere in Canada (actually Ontario) I can tell that at first I felt a little like when I was back in my home country, worried about theft, not that you don't have to be security conscious in every place, but there are areas where you take security for granted. The microwave broke. It was replaced almost immediately. The sofa arm rest fell off. IT was not fixed but I don't see this as a huge deal, only the fact that the thud it made when it fell turned heads. For the rest of it, we had an enjoyable time. Montreal is quite as expected. Nice city. Will I go back again to the same location? Hmm, I'd be interested in checking the prices at the hotel accross from the street first... Then I'll probably make a deciscion. In summary: If you go with family, this could be a good option and if you are not that picky about your vehicle security. If you go alone or as a couple...Hmm, maybe there may be better options. But that's your choice! Hope this helps! Au Revoir!

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Metro if not right in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: plymouth
Reviews.Content: During April, I had four separate stays at this hotel and this means I had the opportunity to view four of the eight rooms available; three of these were genuine 'suites', i.e. separate living room and kitchen to the bedroom. The three suites all offered a good amount of space for two adults. Room No. 1 is not actually a suite, just a bedroom and separate shower/loo. Beds are very comfortable - OK, more impressive than what Sheraton state about theirs! I cannot remember their slogan but found the beds at Parc Suites to be superb. Some of the furnishings are a little tired but, possibly, these will be replaced at the same time as the new extension - yes, the hotel is increasing in size this year! Besides the owner (Mr Demirdogan), three other staff were seen on reception and all very pleasant. Parc Suites is two blocks from the nearest Metro (Place des Arts) and in a reasonably central position but then Montreal is not that large anyway. If you like walking, it is a good location for 'the mountain', for Mordecai Richler's streets named in his novels, for McGill University campus and so on.

Reviews.Title: “would stay again”
Reviews.Author: aglew
Reviews.Content: besides the fact that the staff are helpful and friendly, the rooms are clean and the beds provide kingsize comfort, the hotel is located in a rather central place for sightseeing. we walked everywhere, taking no public transport (except the train from toronto which i recommend over driving in montreal any day), and parc suites is close to the gare centrale train station (20 minute walk) and old montreal and mile end are quite accessible from it as well.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like family.”
Reviews.Author: ariadne74
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a long weekend in Montreal and stayed at the Parc Suites based on TripAdvisor ratings. And I'm glad I listened because this was an absolute top value! I cannot imagine getting a warmer welcome anywhere else. From the moment we got there we got the most hospitable service from the owner who went above and beyond from personally making sure we parked in the right spot to ensuring we had a good stay. The location is central. The rooms are very clean without being sterile. The kitchen is a great feature and the beds are so very very comfortable. I would definitely stay here again without a second thought when I go back to Montreal. The only thing I would caution anyone against is that the hotel does not have an elevator. So, depending on what room you're assigned, you may have to navigate up to 3 flights of stairs.

Reviews.Title: “This was a warm trip despite the cold weather”
Reviews.Author: Vahap
Reviews.Content: We were happy to stay at the Parc Suites. It is a small, boutique style hotel with highly attentive service. The location is convenient and at the heart of the city. Good also for long-term stays. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The owner manager is always around and this is a promising factor for consistent quality. The only shortcoming is that there is no elevator. It might be hard for elderly and particularly disabled people.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great stay at the Parc Suites Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: laroccam
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were delighted and grateful to have stayed at this hotel. We were happy right off the bat with the location and service. The hotel is very clean and decorated elegantly, yet not over the top with nice marble/tile floors, carpets, and other furnishings. wonderful connoisseurs were very helpful and informative, very pleasant to interact and engage with also. they were trying hard to accommodate our wishes and expectations. The only really downside would be the parking, even though it is free. We were just concerned because it is in a back alley and there were street bums sitting around, but they were benign, and after being there for four days, the parking situation was non-threatening and passed with a B. Luckily I own a Honda, but I would have felt uncomfortable if my nice car was just left there idle all evening. I believe they will address this in the future. The stairs can be a bit much for some. Expect to get a good workout. Not ideal for handicapped or disabled persons who can't move well. There is no elevator, so you need to get yourself up and down with ease. the water pressure issue ( We got used to it, but without a doubt, it could have been better). They had suite options, and that is what we had, with a sofa to sit on, two TVS, a kitchenette, etc. It was comfortable and very spacious. We walked to everywhere to because of the location. You can drive if you want, but it wasn't necessary based on this location. The linens and the king size bed is AMAZING---simply divine! I would stay here again and highly recommend it based on what you get for how much you dish out money wise. We didn't need a pool or business center or breakfast area or gym. the room was fine, so I can't knock them for that.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I lived here”
Reviews.Author: keikeinz
Reviews.Content: This place only have a handful of suites, and each of them are designed to make you feel right at home. The decor, furnishings and bathroom are trendy and french-influenced. Everything is new and very comfortable. The suites were large with fully equipped kitchens and the hotel manager is the nicest guy you will ever meet. He gave us great advice on where to eat, told us where we could do our drycleaning (there's a drycleaners just opposite the suite) and greeted us with a big warm smile every time we saw him. Our suites were cleaned everyday (and I never once saw the cleaning lady! now that's good cleaning...) The location isn't too bad... about a 20 min walk to the town centre and there's a great grocery shop nearby. Also its a 15 minute walk to Mont Royal. This place was a bit more expensive than most, but well worth it if you're staying for at least 3 days and want quality and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Blend of luxuary with hospitality”
Reviews.Author: bgurel
Reviews.Content: I heartily endorse the many positive reviews about Parc Suites on Tripadvisor. At Parc Suites, my wife and I found marvelously blended here, the luxuary of a big chain hotel within the warmness/hospitality of a local family hotel. In my experience, a key indicator of what makes a good hotel is the reception. At the Parc Suites, the front-desk staff were very friendly, helpful and always available. They made us feel like the King and the Queen. As noted in other reviews, I found also the facility outstanding (spacious rooms with kitchenette, convenient location, free parking, free Internet + long distance calls, etc.). However, in my opinion, the most prominent feature of this hotel is its finely decorated rooms inline with the building's overall architecture. And I found that the stairs are also a part of this architecture and should be enjoyed. After all, its only a two storey building.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with amazing staff!”
Reviews.Author: sareduf
Reviews.Content: I'll start this be review by saying yes there are stairs. But seriously that's the only con I can think of. The staff was wonderful from check in to check out. They helped us with our bags and were very friendly. The room was huge with a kitchen, two tv's, clean bathroom, comfy king size bed, etc. Very clean, nice location, there is a large grocery store right downstairs, decent diner for breakfast downstairs as well. All in all a great place to stay! Also free parking. It is in the back of the building in a lot but it is free!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and personable service”
Reviews.Author: blhMD
Reviews.Content: This is a small but charming hotel, right downtown, that allows you to experience some of the flavor of old Montreal. It is an old building that has been recently refurbished to include all modern amenities. Our suite included a bedroom with a kingsize bed (with lovely linens and comforter), a bathroom, a sitting room, and a kitchenette with a fullsize refrigerator and a full complement of plates, cups, glasses, silverware, pots, and cooking utensils for those who might be staying for a longer period. Both the bedroom and the sitting room had flat TVs mounted on the wall. The bathroom was lined with marble tile and everything in the suite was spotlessly clean. In addition to the beautiful facilities, perhaps the best thing about the hotel was the management. The manager and staff were very pleasant, very personable, and attentive to our needs in every way. I think this is the Parc Suites' secret weapon in competing with the big hotels in town, because their personal service is really noteworthy. But their free parking is also no small perk in downtown Montreal. Other hotels in the area charge $25 and up for nightly parking fees. There is a staircase to climb upon first entering the hotel, to reach the check-in. I would guess that might make the Parc Suites unsuitable for handicapped visitors. For everyone else, it should be no problem. The staff are very willing to help carry bags up and down the stairs. They seemed to go the extra mile in all they do. This is a lovely hotel and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for large families”
Reviews.Author: movermtl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Parc Suites for a week. The hospitability was wonderful. the room size was large enough to fit me, my wife and our 3 kÄ±ds comfortably. It was our first time in Montreal where we are planning to move soon. The owner's help was invaluable. He told us all about the city and gave us a very good insight about the life in Montreal. The kithcen was very well equipped and was more than enough to prepare healty and economical meals for our large family. The free internet and long distance phone calls were awsome. This hotel is a perfect place for families with many kids and for long term stays.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, and quiet with fantastic service!”
Reviews.Author: picky_picky_v
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Parc Suites for one night, and I had a wonderful experience from start to finish. We were welcomed very warmly, and everything was prepared and ready from the moment we got there. Turgay, the owner, showed us to our room, and let us know about all the amenities that were available (full kitchen, individually heated rooms, HD tv in bedroom and living room, free long distance US/CDA, etc). He was very helpful and polite. The room was spotless and well-organized; it felt like we were the first guests to ever stay there. There was ample space, and the bed was very comfortable. The bathrooms are beautiful and spacious, and the living room was organized nicely for 4 of us to sit around and chat comfortably. The only downside was the low water pressure in the shower, but this is currently being addressed and I'm sure it will be fixed in no time, seeing how attentive the staff is. The location was perfect for our purposes. Chez Cora's downstairs has excellent breakfasts, and if you'd rather not go out to a restaurant, the grocery store (Provigo) is about a 2 minute walk away, and you can prepare something in the kitchen. Close proximity to the Place des Arts metro stop. A wonderful experience, all in all, and I will definitely recommend Parc Suites to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Tip-top brand new rooms with ample space”
Reviews.Author: martinsa
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights on business in Montreal. The staff were very firendly and helpful. The rooms feel brand new and you get a roomy suite with plenty facilities incl a fully equipped kitchen. Free parking, wireless and wired internet, two flatscreens etc. On the downside: Warm water pressure was low so showers were not as comfy as they could have been. The stairs are steep and you need to take them to reach reception, so anyone with heavy luggage or reduced mobility etc should beware. Also, there are none of the amenities of a large hotel in the form of gym, pool, business center etc.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, newly renovated hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Annie129
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in this wonderful and warm hotel and recommend it highly. Our suite was fully equipped with a kitchenette, comfortable bed, and brand-new bathroom. The friendly and helpful owner was in the process of installing new LCD HD tvs in all the rooms and we had the pleasure of enjoying this new feature. The hotel was well located for our purposes, and we enjoyed breakfast in a charming cafe on the corner (Cafe Imagination). The suite was at the back and very quiet. Parking was conveniently provided, although we worried about the safety of the car based on its back-alley location. Overall we would stay at the Parc Suites again!

Reviews.Title: “Central Position, Clean & Comfortable rooms!”
Reviews.Author: scorpio29Brisbane
Reviews.Content: The staff here were very accomodating & helpful. Rooms are very comfortable - we stayed in a suite with seperate bedroom with daughter & boyfriend and when told that the sofa bed in the lounge was most uncomfortable the management immediately put us up in a seperate room at no extra cost. Enjoyed our short stay here & hope to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great find.”
Reviews.Author: Tabies
Reviews.Content: What a pleasure it was to stay at the Parc Suites Hotel. We were very pleasantly surprised by the reasonable cost of our suite. The place was spotless. The bedroom was large with an extremely comfortable mattress on a king size bed. My sister and I took turns in sleeping in this bed and also on the pull-out sofa in living room. The kitchen was equipped with everything you'd ever need - pots and pans, cuttlery, dishes, lovely wine glasses, toaster, coffee maker, microwave. There was a door that opened up onto a tiny balcony with a folding chair and stairs leading down to the roof of building that took you to the parking lot at the back. Now to be fair, I must mention that there were 52 steps from the front door to our room. It did not bother us in the least because we are very fit from going to the gym every day but not everybody could climb all those stairs. A person or couple could easily live there on a permanent basis if they could afford the $120.00 per night that we paid. For sure, whenever I'll be going to Montreal, I will stay at the Parc Suites Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: ratLondon
Reviews.Content: after a conference stay in expensive hotel 2 colleagues and I wanted a cheaper option. All the other hotels I could find at this budget had many terrible reviews amonst the good reviews. So, anxious prior to arrival, especiialy when taxi driver said there was no hotel at this address. Fortunately we had already driven past it on a previous excursion and knew it was there. Another anxious few minutes waiting to be buzzed in, door a bit temperamental and traffic noise drowns out the buzzing sound. Then the narow staircase up. More anxiety as nobody at reception for several minutes. Then the 1st of several very pleasant and helpful receptionists arrived. We said we were going to the oratory and he printed out instructions for the bus route. The place is clean and well-kept. The suite had a closed bedroom with a double bed and balcony. Living room had sofa bed which had seen better days. TV and wifi worked fine. Kitchen fine. 24hr grocery store below and supermarket 30 seconds walk away. Location fine. I would be happy to bring my wife and kids here in the unlikely event that I would ever want to vist montreal again.

Reviews.Title: “Staying at Park Suites Hotel is a MUST when traveling to Montreal”
Reviews.Author: pucmastr
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Montreal this past September. From the very first second we walked into Parc Suites Hotel, we were treated like VIP guests. When we first arrived, Parc Suites had an employee park our car and take up all of our suitcases. We were not familiar with the area very much, so the hotel employee gave us a walking tour of the neighborhood and took us to this great neighborhood that has all sorts of trendy bars and restaurants, a short walk from the hotel. On our second day at Parc Suites, we had dinner reservations near Old Montreal, so we called the front desk to order us a taxi. Turgay, the owner of the hotel called us back and told us that he would drive us to our destination to save us the hassle of taking a cab. We were a little early for our reservation, so on our drive to the restaurant, Turgay gave us a brief driving tour of Old Montreal before our dinner. He went above and beyond what any hotel has ever done for us before. The accommodations at Parc Suites were perfect! Everything in our room seemed brand new. The bed mattress was very comfortable. When we told them we would be using the pull-out couch as a bed, they immediately made that bed for us. Upon checking in, Turgay gave us his business card with his cell phone on it so we could call him at anytime if we had any problems with the hotel room. In addition, the pricing of this hotel was cheaper than most other hotels. We would recommend this hotel to anyone â€“ it is in a great location and has wonderful employees working there. The next time we go to Montreal, we are definitely staying at Parc Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for famly stay!”
Reviews.Author: Maomaohh
Reviews.Content: We would highly recommend all my friends to this hotel! This is one of the best hotels my family has been stayed! The location is very good, the room is very clean (we love the full equiped kitchen and toiliet), the staffs are extemly helpful!
